Container.Name: Orbital Sync
Container.Overview: Orbital Sync synchronizes multiple Pi-hole instances for high availability (HA) using the built-in "teleporter". In other words, it performs a "backup" in the Pi-hole admin interface of your secondary Pi-hole instance, and then "restores" that backup to any number of "secondary" Pi-holes also via their admin interface.

Config.Name: Primary Pi-hole base url
Config.Description: The base URL of your Pi-hole, including the scheme (HTTP or HTTPS) and port but not including a following slash. i.e. 'http://192.168.1.2' or 'https://pihole.example.com'

Config.Name: Primary Pi-hole password
Config.Description: The password used to log in to the admin interface.

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 1 base url
Config.Description: The base URL of your secondary Pi-hole, including the scheme (HTTP or HTTPS) and port but not including a following slash. i.e. 'http://192.168.1.3' or 'https://pihole2.example.com'

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 1 password
Config.Description: The password used to log in to the admin interface.

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 2 base url
Config.Description: The base URL of your secondary Pi-hole, including the scheme (HTTP or HTTPS) and port but not including a following slash. i.e. 'http://192.168.1.4' or 'https://pihole3.example.com'

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 2 password
Config.Description: The password used to log in to the admin interface.

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 3 base url
Config.Description: The base URL of your secondary Pi-hole, including the scheme (HTTP or HTTPS) and port but not including a following slash. i.e. 'http://192.168.1.5' or 'https://pihole4.example.com'

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 3 password
Config.Description: The password used to log in to the admin interface.

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 4 base url
Config.Description: The base URL of your secondary Pi-hole, including the scheme (HTTP or HTTPS) and port but not including a following slash. i.e. 'http://192.168.1.6' or 'https://pihole5.example.com'

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 4 password
Config.Description: The password used to log in to the admin interface.

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 5 base url
Config.Description: The base URL of your secondary Pi-hole, including the scheme (HTTP or HTTPS) and port but not including a following slash. i.e. 'http://192.168.1.7' or 'https://pihole6.example.com'

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 5 password
Config.Description: The password used to log in to the admin interface.

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 6 base url
Config.Description: The base URL of your secondary Pi-hole, including the scheme (HTTP or HTTPS) and port but not including a following slash. i.e. 'http://192.168.1.8' or 'https://pihole7.example.com'

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 6 password
Config.Description: The password used to log in to the admin interface.

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 7 base url
Config.Description: The base URL of your secondary Pi-hole, including the scheme (HTTP or HTTPS) and port but not including a following slash. i.e. 'http://192.168.1.9' or 'https://pihole8.example.com'

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 7 password
Config.Description: The password used to log in to the admin interface.

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 8 base url
Config.Description: The base URL of your secondary Pi-hole, including the scheme (HTTP or HTTPS) and port but not including a following slash. i.e. 'http://192.168.1.10' or 'https://pihole9.example.com'

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 8 password
Config.Description: The password used to log in to the admin interface.

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 9 base url
Config.Description: The base URL of your secondary Pi-hole, including the scheme (HTTP or HTTPS) and port but not including a following slash. i.e. 'http://192.168.1.11' or 'https://pihole10.example.com'

Config.Name: Secondary Pi-hole 9 password
Config.Description: The password used to log in to the admin interface.

Config.Name: Interval minutes
Config.Description: How long to wait between synchronizations. Defaults to five minutes. Remember that the DNS server on your secondary servers restarts everytime a sync is performed. i.e. '5', '30', or '1440'

Config.Name: Sync whitelist
Config.Description: Copies the whitelist

Config.Name: Sync regex whitelist
Config.Description: Copies the regex whitelist

Config.Name: Sync blacklist
Config.Description: Copies the blacklist

Config.Name: Sync regexlist
Config.Description: Copies the regex blacklist

Config.Name: Sync adlist
Config.Description: Copies the adlist

Config.Name: Sync client
Config.Description: Copies clients

Config.Name: Sync group
Config.Description: Copies groups

Config.Name: Sync audit log
Config.Description: Copies the audit log

Config.Name: Sync static dhcp leases
Config.Description: Copies static dhcp leases

Config.Name: Sync local dns records
Config.Description: Copies local DNS records

Config.Name: Sync local cname records
Config.Description: Copies local CNAME records

Config.Name: Sync flush tables
Config.Description: Clears existing data on the secondary (copy target) Pi-hole

Config.Name: Notify on success
Config.Description: Send a notification if a sync completes successfully.

Config.Name: Notify on failure
Config.Description: Send notifications if a sync fails for any reason.

Config.Name: Notify via SMTP
Config.Description: Send notifications via email.

Config.Name: Smtp host
Config.Description: The SMTP server host. i.e. 'smtp.example.com'

Config.Name: Smtp port
Config.Description: The SMTP server port. i.e. '25'/'587'/'465'

Config.Name: Smtp tls
Config.Description: Should usually be set to true if using port 465. Otherwise, leave as is.

Config.Name: Smtp user
Config.Description: The SMTP account username. i.e. 'orbitalsync@example.com'

Config.Name: Smtp password
Config.Description: The SMTP account password.

Config.Name: Smtp from
Config.Description: The email address to send notifications from. i.e. 'orbitalsync@example.com'

Config.Name: Smtp to
Config.Description: The email address to send notifications to. Can be a comma-seperated list. i.e. 'you@example.com'

Config.Name: Verbose mode
Config.Description: Increases the verbosity of log output. Useful for debugging.
